alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Mason; Wirt (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 9:13AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Meigs, northeastern Gallia, southwestern Washington, southeastern Athens, north central Mason, west central Wirt, north central Jackson and southwestern Wood Counties through 945 AM EST... At 912 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rutland, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Belpre, Pomeroy, Racine, Coolville, Rutland, Forked Run State Park, New Haven, Mason, Washington, Tuppers Plains, Lubeck, Middleport, Chester, Syracuse, Hartford City, Cheshire, Portland, Lakin, Reedsville and Little Hocking. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 155 and 168. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
